query: How might the Tribunal weigh conflicting expert opinions?

[Closing Summary .docx, p.1]
Mr./Madam Chair, Members of the Tribunal:

[Closing Summary .docx, p.1]
This Tribunal has heard ample evidence that CITIOM acted in good faith. It selected Gulfstream precisely because of its OEM expertise, its access to historical inspection data, and its warranty support. CITIOM reasonably believed Gulfstream would be transparent and professional. Instead, it was misled—and made to bear the full cost of Gulfstream’s silence.

[Closing Summary .docx, p.1]
We respectfully request that the Tribunal award full damages of at least €4.1 million, along with applicable interest and costs, and send a clear message: that sophisticated parties must honor the trust they are given, and that silence in the face of foreseeable harm is not a defense.

[CITIOM v. Gulfstream - Gulfstream's Responses to CITIOM's Requests for Admission (2025.04.21).pdf, p.2]
Tribunal.

[1. Bassim Haider Direct Outline with Redirect & Rehab.docx, p.1]
Note to Tribunal: CITIOM ultimately sold the Aircraft in November 2024 for ~$1 million less than the value under the signed May 2024 APA, which was explicitly contingent on a June 21 return-to-service dateCITIOM Statement of Cla…No Exhibits - CITIOM v.….
